io.netty.channel

Interface ChannelInboundMessageHandler<I>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Base64Decoder, ByteArrayDecoder, ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter, HttpContentCompressor, HttpContentDecoder, HttpContentDecompressor, HttpContentEncoder, HttpObjectAggregator, MessageLoggingHandler, MessageToMessageCodec, MessageToMessageDecoder, ProtobufDecoder, SctpInboundByteStreamHandler, SctpMessageCompletionHandler, SctpMessageToMessageDecoder, SpdyHttpCodec, SpdyHttpDecoder, SpdyHttpResponseStreamIdHandler, SpdySessionHandler, StringDecoder, WebSocketClientProtocolHandler, WebSocketServerProtocolHandler

    public interface ChannelInboundMessageHandler<I>
    Special ChannelInboundHandler which store the inbound data in a MessageBuf for futher processing. If your ChannelOutboundMessageHandler handles messages of type ByteBuf or Object and you want to add a ByteBuf to the next buffer in the ChannelPipeline use ChannelHandlerUtil.addToNextInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext, Object).

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        ChannelHandler.Sharable

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void freeInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Invoked when this handler is not going to receive any inbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its inbound buffer.
      MessageBuf<I> newInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Return the MessageBuf which will be used for inbound data to store.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandler

        channelActive, channelInactive, channelReadSuspended, channelRegistered, channelUnregistered, inboundBufferUpdated, userEventTriggered

      • Methods inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        afterAdd, afterRemove, beforeAdd, beforeRemove, exceptionCaught
